detailedSummary: Asking questions is fundamental to communication. Spanish uses question words (interrogatives) and inverted question marks (¿?). Question words include: ¿Qué? (What?), ¿Quién?/¿Quiénes? (Who?), ¿Dónde? (Where?), ¿Cuándo? (When?), ¿Por qué? (Why?), ¿Cómo? (How?), ¿Cuánto?/¿Cuánta?/¿Cuántos?/¿Cuántas? (How much/many?), ¿Cuál?/¿Cuáles? (Which?). Yes/no questions can be formed by intonation (raising voice at end) or by adding '¿' at the beginning. Common question structures: '¿Dónde está...?' (Where is...?), '¿Cómo se llama...?' (What is...called?), '¿Cuánto cuesta...?' (How much does...cost?), '¿Qué hora es?' (What time is it?). Basic conversation phrases: '¿Hablas inglés?' (Do you speak English?), 'No entiendo' (I don't understand), '¿Puede repetir?' (Can you repeat?), 'Hablo un poco de español' (I speak a little Spanish), 'Más despacio, por favor' (Slower, please). Understanding question formation enables you to gather information, navigate situations, and engage in meaningful conversations.
whyItMatters: Asking questions is essential for communication - mastering question formation enables you to get information, clarify understanding, and engage in real conversations with Spanish speakers.

assignments.title: Practice Asking Questions in Spanish
assignments.description: Learn to form questions and engage in basic conversations in Spanish.
tasks: Create 20 questions using different question words (qué, quién, dónde, etc.)
Practice asking and answering questions about personal information
Write a dialogue script with at least 10 questions and responses
Create flashcards for question words and common conversation phrases

quizzes.question: What question word means 'Where?' in Spanish?
quizzes.explanation: '¿Dónde?' means 'Where?' and is used to ask about location (e.g., '¿Dónde está el baño?' - Where is the bathroom?).

quizzes.question: Spanish uses inverted question marks (¿) at the beginning of questions.
quizzes.explanation: True. Spanish uses both opening (¿) and closing (?) question marks, making questions easy to identify when reading.

quizzes.question: How do you say 'I don't understand' in Spanish?
quizzes.explanation: 'No entiendo' means 'I don't understand' and is essential for communication when you need clarification.
